entries.meaning: The act of begging; an imploring request.

verbs.description: beg (third-person singular simple present begs, present participle begging, simple past and past participle begged)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To request the help of someone, often in the form of money.
examples: He begged on the street corner from passers-by.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To plead with someone for help, a favor, etc.; to entreat.
examples: I beg your pardon. I didnâ€™t mean to cause offence.
He begged her to go to the prom with him.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To unwillingly provoke a negative, often violent, reaction.
examples: The way you keep eating raw meat, you're just begging to get tapeworms.

entries.meaning: (transitive) In the phrase beg the question: to assume.
(transitive, proscribed) In the phrase beg the question: to raise (a question).
(transitive, law, obsolete) To ask to be appointed guardian for, or to ask to have a guardian appointed for.
examples: Else some will beg thee, in the court of wards.

entries.meaning: A provincial governor under the Ottoman Empire; a bey.

examples: Knit with MC until work measures 3 inches from beg.
